caption:
‚ÄúI thought I needed to teach my kids that life can be hard... but life does a perfectly adequate job teaching that on its own. So I realized I was probably most useful teaching my kids what can be easy: How easy it can be to laugh, to love, to cry, to learn...and to find joy in both the plans and the detours alike.‚Äù

JAMES VAN DER BEEK
Suits

One of the most meaningful moments of my life was when I told you my dreams of becoming a filmmaker, and you smiled‚Äîthat soft, soulful smile‚Äîand said that your dream was to be a mother and to travel the world.

I didn‚Äôt fully understand why it moved me so deeply then. But I do now.
It‚Äôs because, in that moment, you were showing me a dream that was pure. And deep down, all I wanted was to be with that woman. 

A woman whose dream was to love her children with everything she had and to explore the world together in wonderment. 

And now‚Ä¶ just let that sink in.

You‚Äôve become that woman‚Äîand so much more.

Just look at you. You‚Äôve not only become the woman you dreamed of‚Äîyou‚Äôve surpassed her in every way.
You‚Äôve created a life that most people spend a lifetime hoping for.
But you didn‚Äôt stumble into it. You built it.

You‚Äôre now only 38, and already, you‚Äôve painted a life more vivid and honest than most dare to dream.
Not through luck or chance‚Äîbut by choosing it, nurturing it, becoming it.
You didn‚Äôt just chase your dream‚Äîyou embodied it.
And in doing so, you‚Äôve become a quiet revolution.
A woman who lives so fully in her truth, she awakens others simply by being herself.

This past year alone‚Äîyou‚Äôve led us from Greece to Maine, through Acadia‚Äôs wild beauty, and across Europe once again‚ÄîSpain, Germany, Austria, Italy. A dream life that‚Äôs somehow real. Because you made it so.

And through it all, you‚Äôve remained the strongest, most nurturing soul I‚Äôve ever known.
You mother without asking for credit. You give without asking for thanks.
You plan, organize, carry, create‚Äîand you do it all with grace.
You are breathtaking in every way. And yet somehow, you continue to gain beauty with age.

I‚Äôm ready to admit that I had to grow to see what you saw all along.
And I‚Äôm so grateful I did‚Äîbecause this life we‚Äôve built, this family, you‚Äî
It‚Äôs everything I never knew I wanted, until you showed me it was possible.

It is the greatest honor of my life to be your husband.

Happy Birthday to the woman who makes life the most beautiful adventure.
I love you beyond what words can hold.

From the very beginning, you‚Äôve made me smile easier than anyone.
You were such a funny baby‚Ä¶bright, quick, curious, and somehow, it felt like you were already here, fully formed, just figuring out how to walk and talk as fast as you could.

And you did. You‚Äôve always moved fast. Thought fast. Eaten fast. And loved with your whole heart. 

You‚Äôve spent more time on my shoulders than anywhere else, because that‚Äôs just where you fit right from the very start. And even now, when I close my eyes, I can still feel the weight of you there, your little chubby hands holding on, both of us just being together.

You have a heart full of joy, kindness, and this deep, emotional strength that not many people your age carry. You care so deeply about the people you love, and you protect them with everything you‚Äôve got.

You‚Äôre creative, thoughtful, hilarious, and full of light. Whether you‚Äôre baking your gluten free double tree oat cookies or drawing with that wildly vivid imagination of yours, you put your whole heart into it. And that is so special, and it shows in everything you do.

Watching you with your brothers, or with your best friend Leo, is one of my favorite things in the world. That lemonade and orange juice stand you made outside your school, that wasn‚Äôt just cool that was magic.

And every time you ask me for a bedtime story, my heart just swells. You don‚Äôt know what that means to me. You don‚Äôt know what you mean to me. But someday you will.

My eyes fill when I think about all the moments that shaped you into the boy you are, and the man you‚Äôll one day become. You are a gift. So much light, and so much joy!

It‚Äôs an honor to be your dad. Truly. What a pleasure to say I‚Äôm your Father, Son.

Happy golden birthday, Jole. I love you so, so much.

You‚Äôve changed my life in more ways than I can ever explain. From the moment you were born, there was something different about you. Your eyes, your spirit, the way you looked at the world as if you already knew something most people don‚Äôt.

You‚Äôre the kind of person who makes the world better just by being in it. You lift people up without even trying. You bring calm. You bring laughter. You bring heart. Every single day, someone tells me how incredible you are, and every single time, I smile because I already know.

You‚Äôve faced challenges that could have made you bitter or discouraged, but instead, you became stronger. You became wiser. You became more compassionate. You‚Äôve shown me how to choose joy, even when it‚Äôs gluten free. You‚Äôve shown your brothers what kindness looks like. You‚Äôve shown the world what it means to live with a glass half full.

You‚Äôve helped me become the father I always hoped to be. Watching you grow up has been the greatest honor of my life. And now, as you step into your teenage years, you‚Äôre not someone still trying to figure out who they are. You already know. And you‚Äôre not afraid to be that person. You‚Äôll inspire others to do the same.

Wherever your journey takes you, just know I‚Äôm always walking right behind you. Cheering you on. Learning from you. Loving you more than words can hold.

I am so proud of you. And this world is better with you in it.

To the ends of the earth, happy birthday, Jace.
An immortal gaze
These buildings are growing on me.
In between the hustle‚Ä¶there‚Äôs flow.
This mural watches the sun rise.
This mural sings.

Happy Birthday, Maria!

Yesterday was a perfect reflection of the life you lead‚Äîselflessly creating the most incredible birthday party for Jole, without a single mention of your own special day. Your beauty and thoughtfulness shine through in everything you do. Your natural ability to mother has become a superpower, one that you‚Äôve earned through hard work and dedication. I‚Äôve seen the effort you put in, silently and without complaint. You never hesitate, frown, or vent. The only way anyone would even know of the endless things you do for your family is by witnessing it firsthand‚Äîthe boxes, the planning, the calendars, the emails, the books, the groceries, the toys, the candy, the art supplies. You are the most stunning and beautiful woman, and somehow, you keep winning mother of the year. As a father, it‚Äôs the greatest gift I could hope for our boys.

Being here in Greece with you is a testament to the relationship we‚Äôve built. The moments we‚Äôve shared in this life, and those we continue to create, mean the world to me. You‚Äôve brought such joy, clarity, and meaning to my life, improving my mental and physical well-being every single day. Today, as we celebrate you, I want you to know how profoundly you impact not only me, but those around you. With you, the skies keep getting bluer, and the waters keeps getting clearer.

Brother‚Äîit‚Äôs the most meaningful word I know. Having two brothers myself, I understand what it means to carry a part of someone else deep within your consciousness for your entire life. The feeling that without them, you‚Äôre not whole. With my three boys, I see this same connection.

I‚Äôm so fortunate to watch them take on new challenges and overcome old fears. They‚Äôre growing into confident, independent young men, stepping into new roles, and finding their own paths.

Despite their fights and unparalleled ability to get under each other‚Äôs skin, their bond is deep and unbreakable. They bring out the best in each other and have formed a strong support system, backed by blood, sweat, tears, and tickle fights.

C.S. Lewis said, ‚ÄòIn each of my friends there is something that only some other friend can fully bring out.‚Äô This couldn‚Äôt be more true, especially within brotherhood. My sons are not just growing up together, they‚Äôre growing into each other‚Äôs strengths and life stories. They are brothers in the most profound sense, and that‚Äôs something truly deserving of the most meaningful word I know.

Just before beginning what would have been a year-long home renovation, that we had planned for years‚Äîwe decided to leave the world we knew behind to start a new chapter, far from home. Along the way we expanded our understanding of what home really means. Home isn‚Äôt within new pavements or fancy tiles. Home is within us, in our togetherness. It grows richer with every new experience we share and every bit of beauty we take in. The more we learn to appreciate all of the beauty, the more we see of it‚Ä¶the more we experience it. 

The other night, Jace asked me, ‚ÄòDaddy, has living here changed you?‚Äô I felt the entirety of that question, and after a thoughtful pause, I said, ‚ÄòYes, it has.‚Äô And before I could even finish, he burst out, ‚ÄòMe too!‚Äô 

That moment will stay with me forever, melting my heart and sending the good shivers down my spine. What a wonderful world we get to live in.

I tell myself I‚Äôm a storyteller, yet sometimes that feels like the only story I‚Äôm telling. I talk of achieving incredible things, yet I scarcely believe it myself. Belief‚Äîit‚Äôs a peculiar thing. It seems you only truly accomplish something once you deeply, unquestionably know that you will‚Äîthat‚Äôs when you actually do it. It‚Äôs so common for us to identify with the stories we tell ourselves, the ones we choose to believe in. And eventually, we become the very characters we‚Äôve described.

The narrative of our lives is being written, and inevitably, we‚Äôll walk upon a ledge. We can stand there, peering over the edge, and if we do, the ending is as certain as the ground below. But there‚Äôs another choice. If we can convince ourselves to believe‚Äîto trust‚Äîthat when we leap from this ledge, when we dive into the unknown, the world has actually been patiently waiting all this time to catch us on the other side and share with us all its beauty.

That‚Äôs a story I can tell, a true story. Because I‚Äôm a storyteller.

Off the coast of Syros, I find myself aboard a beautiful yacht. Surrounded by new friends who inspire me, who seek beauty and lean into laughter. It‚Äôs almost a mystery how I‚Äôve arrived here. How a series of decisions led me to this exact moment. Yet, here I am, on a sailboat in Greece, amidst mountains of wisdom, a sea of love and support, and a crew of intentional souls. Everything is illuminated.

To my wife, the mother of our children, beautiful, funny, and strong‚ÄîYou are the rock for our boys as you‚Äôve always been for me.

Your love for reading, crafting, and traveling has set a wonderful example for them. Now, we find ourselves in Greece, absorbing a sea of culture, exploring pottery, and discovering new perspectives on the world.

Through your teachings and your passions, you have inspired our boys to be themselves and to bless the world with their incredible spirit and good intentions.

You say you are not creative, yet you have expertly guided these children with careful attention and clear intention. They have grown to be wholesome and real, well-behaved, and sometimes brave.

As an incredible mother, you‚Äôve inspired them to rise to wherever the world might take them, to willingly confront challenges, and to always be there for each other.

Happy Mother‚Äôs Day.

Jace wrote a lyrical poem while we were in Naxos and I was moved by his words and wanted to share them with you. Turns out I was taking these photos while he was writing his song.

Live a Little
by Jace

A boy sits on a perfectly placed rock
in a perfectly placed area,
in a perfectly placed world,
in a perfectly placed universe,
waiting for the days to go by.

Years and years pass by,
and the boy had a thought from listening to what the other people would say,
‚ÄúI realize that the only way to get through life is to live a little,
instead of waiting for the days to go by.‚Äù

So he gets up from his rock,
thinking of things to do while he‚Äôs away,
And once he figures it out,
he goes ahead and runs away.

As the man gets up from his rock,
another boy walks by and sits on the perfectly placed rock,
in the perfectly placed area,
in the perfectly placed world,
in the perfectly placed universe,
just waiting for the days to go by.

Every challenge presents a call to leap, expanding our horizons. As we find the courage to jump, we inspire those around us and we eventually realize something beautiful. Our children aren‚Äôt just following‚Äîthey‚Äôre bravely leading, not only us, but future generations into tomorrow.

Watching our boys dance with the waves and lay in the sand, I‚Äôm reminded of a different kind of investment. Not one where money multiplies into more money, but where it rolls up into cocoons and transforms‚Äîemerging as butterflies that bless the world. These blessings return as experiences that shape our character, change our perspectives, and guide us to the true riches of life.

Tracing the paths of our childhood, my boys nearly mirror the adventures my brothers and I once had. Except, this time we are reunited in beautiful Naxos for Easter weekend, swapping the daily grind for quality time and a heated pool.
ŒΩŒµœÅœå

Exploring ancient caves today and I found joy in the simple act of discovery. It‚Äôs moments like these where we are surrounded by history and beauty that spark the greatest conversations. How ‚Äúfun‚Äù might just be a human perception of experimentation, and how each particle participates in this conscious behavior.

With water as clear as the thoughts these times inspire, I‚Äôm reminded of how close ‚Äòliving‚Äô and ‚Äòloving‚Äô are‚Äînot just in letters, but in every moment we spend together. 

I‚Äôm very grateful to have my mom and brothers visiting us here in Greece, sharing this beautiful journey. Here‚Äôs to living fully and loving deeply, surrounded by the beauty of the world and the warmth of my family.
Rooftop vibes with my favorite crew. Hot cocoa, cool breezes, and action poses, all while enjoying the vista. I‚Äôm bottling up these goofy yet beautiful moments.

From morning homemade waffles to evening Django gelato, our days are woven with laughter, love, and everything in between‚Ä¶Whether it‚Äôs scoring goals at the park, Jole‚Äôs pinecone collection, or strolling down marble pathways, every step is a precious memory made together.
Home isn‚Äôt a place, it‚Äôs a feeling that‚Äôs created in moments, shared with the ones we love, wherever we wander. Footprints in the sand.
A beautiful night with beautiful people
Im grateful for these moments.
There‚Äôs nothing quite like a pick and roll for breakfast
A glistening afternoon at Kini beach.
Just a little flex‚Äîmy family glows in the golden hour.

A refreshing morning dip in the Aegean Sea.

To my oldest, Jace, I see you. Your passion for reading, your excitement to learn, and the love and honesty you share with us all‚Äîit doesn‚Äôt go unnoticed. You‚Äôre not just a son and a brother, you‚Äôre a role model, an inspiration. Every day, you show us what it means to be a good person, and for that, I couldn‚Äôt be more proud. I‚Äôm honored to be your guide. Keep being you, son. I love you.
We're going to be "in the room where it happens."

To the endlessly beautiful woman who has transformed my world and captivated my heart for over 22 years - you are my dream come true. Here's to you, a rose to symbolize each decade our love has continued to blossom üåπüåπ

I've always loved Indian cuisine but only recently have I started making Indian dishes. 

Coconut and kale quinoa with coconut kidney beans along with some pickled onions, korma sauce, and mustard seeds.

I love the simplicity of this dish and it's delicious. I usually slice up an avocado with this meal but they weren't ripe enough today.
"There's no place like home"
